Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani will be playing his first regular-season game at Angel Stadium as a member of the Dodgers on Tuesday night.
Ohtani has been chasing MLB history with his 44 home runs and 46 stolen bases, leaving the league’s first 50-50 season within reach.
Ohtani mentioned that he has never been in such a good position in September and is experiencing a heightened sense of urgency playing against a divisional rival.
Post-Match Reflections: Ohtani deflected speculation about the Angels' decision not to match his $700 million proposal, expressing gratitude for the teams that evaluated him highly.
Ohtani stated that he is doing his best with the Dodgers with the goal of winning the World Series.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts noted that the Angels' lack of success had nothing to do with Ohtani's performance.
Dodgers third base coach Dino Ebel expects Ohtani to receive a warm ovation from Angels fans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani's last game with the Angels was on Sept. 3, 2023, and he will be returning to Angel Stadium on the first anniversary of that date.
The Angels did not match the $700 million offer Ohtani and his agent presented during his free agency.
Ohtani is expected to receive a warm ovation from Angels fans despite the team's decision not to re-sign him.
